Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip interior glazed streaky black with part of lotus bud in white outline with red centre above red band lined in white; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0946) (phase 2)
